weeklyTopNews.title: No active coronavirus cases in South Australia as restrictions set to ease
weeklyTopNews.summary: This is the first time South Australia has had zero active cases in two months.

weeklyTopNews.title: More than 170 close contacts of pair who skipped quarantine free to leave isolation
weeklyTopNews.summary: This was announced after the pair tested negative for the virus.

weeklyTopNews.title: Queensland and WA announce they will reopen borders in time for Christmas
weeklyTopNews.summary: These decisions ahve been made now that fears of community transmission in Sydney have been laid to rest and after South Australia recorded no cases this week.

weeklyTopNews.title: Australia remains on track to give its first coronavirus vaccinations by March next year
weeklyTopNews.summary: Federal Health Minister Greg Hunt says Australian citizens can expect COVID-19 vaccinations in March next year, starting with health care workers and the elderly.

weeklyTopNews.title: WA could delay reopening borders after NSW hotel quarantine worker tested positive for coronavirus
weeklyTopNews.summary: Genomic testing is underway to determine how the worker acquired the virus.
